edu.ftdev.Maze

Class MazeCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ftdev.DrawingFactory
      • edu.ftdev.Maze.MazeCanvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DbgControls, FrameControls, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class MazeCanvas
extends DrawingFactory

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  MazeCanvas.CellState
      Extracts the internal state of a maze cell, like the sides walled-in, the sides with paths drawn over, etc.
      static class  MazeCanvas.Side
      Identifies a side of a maze cell.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void clear()
      Clears the rendering canvas of this maze.

      Draws a cell on the rendering canvas of this maze.
      By default the cell is surrounded by walls on all sides, it has a white shade, no center and no connecting paths.

      Draws a cell on the rendering canvas of this maze.
      The cell is surrounded by walls on all sides, it has the given shade color, no center and no connecting paths.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MazeCanvas

        public MazeCanvas()
        Constructs a Maze canvas of 16 rows and 24 columns. Each cell in the maze is sized to 20x20 pixels.
        Use the DrawingFactory.open() method to open the window and render the maze further.
        See Also:
        MazeCanvas(int, int, int), DrawingFactory.open()

      • MazeCanvas

        public MazeCanvas(int nRows,
                  int nCols,
                  int cellWidth)
        Constructs a Maze canvas of a given number of rows and columns. Each cell in the maze is a square pixel area of the given width.
        Use the DrawingFactory.open() method to open the window and render the maze further.
        Parameters:
        nRows - - number of rows in the grid of maze cells.
        nCols - - number of columns in the grid of maze cells.
        cellWidth - - pixel size of one maze cell.
        See Also:
        MazeCanvas(), DrawingFactory.open()

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the rendering canvas of this maze.
        The window containing this canvas is brought back to its default state as it was when it was first opened. All prior rendering for individual maze cells is lost.
        Overrides:
        clear in class DrawingFactory
        See Also:
        DrawingFactory.open()

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Provides the number of rows in the grid of cells for this maze.
        Returns:
        number of rows.
        See Also:
        MazeCanvas(int, int, int)

      • getCols

        public int getCols()
        Provides the number of columns in the grid of cells for this maze.
        Returns:
        number of columns.
        See Also:
        MazeCanvas(int, int, int)

      • drawCell

        public boolean drawCell(int row,
                        int col)
        Draws a cell on the rendering canvas of this maze.
        By default the cell is surrounded by walls on all sides, it has a white shade, no center and no connecting paths.
        Parameters:
        row - - row of the cell in the maze grid.
        col - - column of the cell in the maze grid.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false in case of an error: window not opened or coordinates out of range.
        See Also:
        DrawingFactory.open(), MazeCanvas.Side

      • drawCell

        public boolean drawCell(int row,
                        int col,
                        Color color)
        Draws a cell on the rendering canvas of this maze.
        The cell is surrounded by walls on all sides, it has the given shade color, no center and no connecting paths.
        Parameters:
        row - - row of the cell in the maze grid.
        col - - column of the cell in the maze grid.
        color - - the shade color for this cell.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false in case of an error: window not opened or coordinates out of range.
        See Also:
        DrawingFactory.open(), drawCell(int, int), MazeCanvas.Side

      • drawWall

        public boolean drawWall(int row,
                        int col,
                        MazeCanvas.Side side)
        Draws a wall on a given side of a cell. The cell is identified by its row and column location in the maze grid.
        The wall is rendered over the cell's shade color, if any, and under the same-side path segment if one exist.
        Parameters:
        row - - row of the cell in the maze grid.
        col - - column of the cell in the maze grid.
        side - - side of the cell where the wall is to be drawn.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false in case of an error: window not opened or coordinates out of range.
        See Also:
        drawCell(int, int), MazeCanvas.Side, eraseWall(int, int, Side)

      • eraseWall

        public boolean eraseWall(int row,
                         int col,
                         MazeCanvas.Side side)
        Erases a wall from the given side of a cell. The cell is identified by its row and column location in the maze grid.
        The wall is erased without affecting the same-side path segment, if one exists, or the shade of the cell, if any.
        Parameters:
        row - - row of the cell in the maze grid.
        col - - column of the cell in the maze grid.
        side - - side of the cell where the wall is to be drawn.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false in case of an error: window not opened or coordinates out of range.
        See Also:
        drawCell(int, int), MazeCanvas.Side, drawWall(int, int, Side)

      • drawPath

        public boolean drawPath(int row,
                        int col,
                        MazeCanvas.Side side,
                        Color color)
        Draws a path segment on a given side of a cell, in the specified color. The cell is identified by its row and column location in the maze grid.
        The segment is rendered over the cell's wall and shade, if any exist.
        Parameters:
        row - - row of the cell in the maze grid.
        col - - column of the cell in the maze grid.
        side - - side of the cell where the segment is to be drawn.
        color - - color of the segment.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false in case of an error: window not opened or coordinates out of range.
        See Also:
        drawCell(int, int), MazeCanvas.Side, erasePath(int, int, Side)

      • erasePath

        public boolean erasePath(int row,
                         int col,
                         MazeCanvas.Side side)
        Erases a path segment from a given side of a cell. The cell is identified by its row and column location in the maze grid.
        Once the segment is erased, the obscured wall and shade, if any, become visible.
        Parameters:
        row - - row of the cell in the maze grid.
        col - - column of the cell in the maze grid.
        side - - side of the cell from which to erase the segment.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false in case of an error: window not opened or coordinates out of range.
        See Also:
        drawCell(int, int), MazeCanvas.Side, drawPath(int, int, Side, Color)

      • drawShade

        public boolean drawShade(int row,
                         int col,
                         Color color)
        Draws the shade (background) of a cell in a given color.
        Parameters:
        row - - row of the cell in the maze grid.
        col - - column of the cell in the maze grid.
        color - - color of the center.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false in case of an error: window not opened or coordinates out of range.
        See Also:
        DrawingFactory.open(), eraseShade(int, int)

      • eraseShade

        public boolean eraseShade(int row,
                          int col)
        Erases the shade (background) of a cell to the default white color.
        Parameters:
        row - - row of the cell in the maze grid.
        col - - column of the cell in the maze grid.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false in case of an error: window not opened or coordinates out of range.
        See Also:
        DrawingFactory.open(), drawShade(int, int, Color)
